body: Thanks, looks like a bug. Thanks for the concise and clear repro ðŸ™‚

issue.title: Transition fade out-in doesn't work as expected on first load
issue.body:
**HTML Markup**
`<transition name="fade" mode="out-in">
    <component :is="selectedModule"></component>
</transition>`

**Components Load**
`Vue.component('component-a', httpVueLoader.load('app/components/component-a.vue', 'component-a'));
Vue.component('component-b', httpVueLoader.load('app/components/component-b.vue', 'component-b'));
Vue.component('component-c', httpVueLoader.load('app/components/component-c.vue', 'component-c'));`

It appears the _out-in_ transition behaves the same as the _in-out_ transition (Component B fades in before/during Component A fade out), but only on the first load of the component.  If switching between previously loaded (cached?) components, transitions behave as expected.  Please see the attached GIF demonstrating the behavior.

I've been digging into the source in hopes to address this myself through a pull request, but unfortunately I'm very new to Vue and some of this is still a mystery to me.  If there's anything else I can provide, I'm happy to do so.  Thanks!

**Demo GIF**
![vuetransitionerror_20170524](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6201067/26434297/a152ca7c-40cd-11e7-8528-4c9ff92e6bf0.gif)

body: It seems the async component is rendered too early

I have solved, wait a minute ...

When rendering `async components`, we need to use a hidden element placeholder

issue.title: fix #5760: transition async component error

repository.name: vue

body:
Are you sure this solves the async component transitions?  I'm new to Vue so it's likely a bug in my code, but my repo below still exhibits the transition out-in bug where the incoming component doesn't wait for the out fade to complete.  Note I'm using the http-vue-loader named above.

[Async Component Transition Bug Demo](https://github.com/clingor/githubIssuesFileShare/tree/master/vue-async-component-bug)
This is indeed still failing with the same repro. The transition starts right away as @clingor said

The fix has not been released yet. We closed issues when the patch lands in the `dev` branch, but it might not be in a public release yet.

2.3.4 only contains a single fix for a memory leak (which has higher priority)
My bad, I just saw the commit was before the release and thought it was strange. It would have been in the release notes anyway
Sorry for the misunderstanding, and thank you for confirming the issue!

This doesn't appear to be fixed yet in 2.4.2.  Is this still pending release?

[Async Component Transition Bug Demo](https://github.com/clingor/githubIssuesFileShare/tree/master/vue-async-component-bug)
@clingor Are you sure? The jsfiddle works nicely

The fiddle does work correctly, but the code in [my example GitHub repo](https://github.com/clingor/githubIssuesFileShare/tree/master/vue-async-component-bug) still exhibits the same behavior.  It could be the [http-vue-loader](https://github.com/FranckFreiburger/http-vue-loader) helper library, or maybe something in my code.  This example is simple and was created to demonstrate [the issue](https://github.com/FranckFreiburger/http-vue-loader/issues/6).

@FranckFreiburger  would any of these VueJS changes require an update to [http-vue-loader](https://github.com/FranckFreiburger/http-vue-loader)?
if you put the issue on a jsfiddle without the loader I can take a look

Steps to reproduce

2. click the "B" button
